Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service and love the coffee!”
Reviews.Author: OzChards
Reviews.Content: Very central location and the service was excellent. Loved the coffee machine in the room and breakfast was nice too particularly the chocolate sprinkles and croissants. Lovely atmosphere in the hotel and modern and comfortable. My partner had a sensitivity to perfumes so she found the room deodoriser that housekeeping used a little overpowering but no problem for me. Reception arranged for housekeeping to not spray the rooms which was fine. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_Torres
Reviews.Content: Comfortable double. Spacious, clean bathroom and the in-room espresso machine really took care of jet lag, once I figured out how to work it. Our 5th floor street side room was too warm (a floor fan was provided), with no climate control that we could find, and noisy with the windows open but given the location, acceptable. One complaint is door key light, closet interior lights were difficult or impossible to turn off, making sleep a little difficult. E14 breakfast was a little expensive but good with cold cuts, fruit, cheese as well as breakfast stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel as tourist base”
Reviews.Author: rob-Bewdley
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 nights at the Albus and was very pleased. It's a 4* (rather than 5*) but the rooms and the staff are definitely 5*. The room was very spacious, bathroom was excellent with a nice wetroom. One gripe I have is that there is no free wifi in the room - you are asked to buy a package of extra TV (smut etc) and internet access at 14 euros a night BUT there is a free PC with Internet in the lobby so you don't have to spend the extra. My only other suggestion is to request a room that doesn't face onto the main road (Vijzelstraat) as the dunken/stoned revellers do wander up that road from leidsplein most of the night and can be very noisy - i'm sure any of the rooms that faced away from the main road would be perfectly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: RuiAna_ptbr
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights on a business trip to always busy Amsterdam. This is a small hotel on a very good location, near the flower market, with easy walking access to the shopping areas on both Leidsestraat or Utrechtsestraat for instance, also with dozens of options to eat nearby, e.g. around Rembrandt Square. The staff at reception desk was always kind and a gesture from the management deserves a note: I had an invitation for a drink (Prosecco) at the bar on arrival. A simple gesture that says a lot about hospitality. Breakfast had good quality and choice but seemed a bit disorganised. On the first morning nobody asked me the room number and I think I almost ate unnoticed... Wi-Fi access worked fairly. I don't think it is included in the room rate, but I got a voucher without asking wneh checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Modernity and good taste”
Reviews.Author: Mafalda B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 5-10 mins walking from Dam Square, the service has been PERFECT, staff really kind and everything was clean and tidy. The hotel style is modern and classy - there is also a Nespresso in the rooms and a gorgeous shower. We found a big deal so the price was really small - on the other hand the meals (not included) were too much expensive. We'll come back in Ams for sure and we'll book the Albus again, it has been perfect. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Juddster1
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Kalverstraat made this hotel ideal for our recent business trip to Amsterdam. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The decor of the lobby area was very contemporary but still welcoming. My single room was on the 5th floor at the front of the building, the living area was a good size as was the bathroom, except for the tiny shower with the ceiling giant rainfall shower head. Fortunately, I did have to wash my hair, but goodness knows how I would have gone if I didn't need too. There is no room to get away from the water. After reading reviews about the noise, I did approach bedtime with some caution, but we were only in town for one night, I thought it would be bearable, because trams and traffic don't really bother me. However, the idiots who continually shouted and tooted car horns from midnight to 6am made my night a challenge. Certainly, if you stay, do take the advice of other reviewers and request a quiet room if you need to sleep. Oh, one last thing, it was cold and rainy on our last day, after shopping I sat in the lobby waiting for my colleagues to return before leaving for the airport. The chairs were comfy, the gas fire warming and the hot chocolate I ordered was one of the best I've had. The Albus will be on our list of possible hotels when we plan our working trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel and very good location”
Reviews.Author: minga670
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and clean.Its right in the center of everything, so we were able to walk everywhere. There is no Wi-Fi in the rooms. The size of the room we were in was extremely small. We were there in the begining of March and it was freezing in the bathroom when we wanted to take a shower in the morning. The staff was very helpfull and friendly. It was my husbands birthday on the day we arrived to the hotel and when we came back at night after exploring the city there was a complimentary bottle of wine in our room and a card wishing him a Happy Birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: iholiday
Reviews.Content: I have just return from a few nights in Amsterdam where we stayed at the Albus Hotel. The hotel is lovely, very modern and beautifully decorated, the staff were all very helpful and the food was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a good 4* in a central location. We stayed on B&B and the breakfast was good, there was a buffet with a good selection of food from hot breakfast to pastries and fruit, something for everyone. The rooms are quite small but this is to be expected in a city centre location, but very well equipped. We had a room on the 6th floor at the back of the hotel which was very quiet, except a noisy neighbour... but that cant be helped! The bathroom was spacious with a large shower, there was also a safe which is free of charge to use in the room, the coffee machine was a big plus too! There is a nice wine bar area at the hotel and a restaurant which we didn't actually eat at but the food looked great. The trams are the best way to travel around the city and there is a stop a minute or so down the road from the hotel and another just round the corner which will take you to pretty much anywhere in the city. The best thing to do it get the train from Schiphol airport for about 8euro per person return and then get a tram pass from the GVB ticket office outside central station, we got a 48hr pass for 24euro. This way you can jump on and off the trams as much as you like during your stay. The staff at the hotel are able to give you tram maps, and also offered to make us any dinner reservations or book excursions for us (At the same price as the shops on the streets which I thought was very handy). Overall we had a lovely stay and would not hesitate to stay at the Albus again if we decided to return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Centrally Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RayChapmanHastings
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over New Year for the Rapido Circuit event. The staff were excellent, rooms were pleasant and demonstrated good value for money. There is also regular direct trams to Amsterdam Central Station for Schiphol. The only issue is the cost of the wi fi access and that the wi fi access didnt work in the room which I guess is due to the position of the router.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: lauraliz86
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute and didnt really know much about it, just wanted a hotel close to the city centre. I was very pleasantly surprised when we got there and saw the beautiful interiors in the reception area and the restaurant. The staff were also extremely helpful and polite. We had one of the standard double rooms, it was bright and modern with a coffee machine (great for two coffee lovers) and complimentary water. We had a lovely little balcony which was a great little extra to the room. The bathroom was lovely and spacious, very clean with a huge shower. The room was extremely comfortable and we both really enjoyed our stay there. The staff were more than helpful and the location is perfect, just a couple of minutes walk and you're right in the city centre. All in all a great little hotel, will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a medium budget in Amsterdam.... Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: tripadvocator
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of the Albus, and have to say it exceeded my expectations. Location is central, and the hotel is surprisingly smart, with a cosy wine bar in the reception, spotless new rooms and huge rain showers in the bathrooms. Ours was a small room on the back of the 4th floor and was very quiet at night. Staff were helpful, and they have booklets with staff recommendations of what to see and do in Amsterdam that were really personal. There is a bike rental shop just around the corner on Reguliersdwarsstraat, or alternatively you can walk everywhere from here. For the very reasonable price (booked with BA avios points) I was expecting something a lot more basic, so was pleasantly surprised to find it was cosy, comfortable, smart and ideal for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, fresh decor and great reception staff.”
Reviews.Author: mebanana
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice if you come to Amsterdam - all the main attractions are walkable or a short tram ride away. The rooms are very comfortable (the bed especially!) and have flat-screen tvs. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, they even managed to sort us out with a pizza at 4.30am when everywhere else was closed. I'd definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location but Beware of hidden city charges and staff who do not have customer service skills!!”
Reviews.Author: Sushie78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend on a leisurely visit to Amsterdam. The hotel appears to be newly refurbished. Rooms are Nice, contemporary, clean but the smart city room is a little on the small side, but that did not bother me. On arrival we checked in as normal. The next day, we were out for the day and on return our room key was blocked. The receptionist then informed us that we have not paid the city tax so the key was blocked. We told the receptionist that we were not aware of any tax. However, they asked for 5 per cent of the room rate so we setteled the bill and we were advised that there would not be any further charges. The next day the same thing happened which was at this point very frustrating!!! We complained That we should have been advised of this on arrival and shouldn't be harassed during our stay! Then to top it up, on the last night of our stay the receptionist called our room at 9:30pm asking for 100 Euros for deposit for the room! At this point I was very angry as we were checking out in the morning and the hotel should have sorted all charges and deposits on arrival not when you are getting ready to leave and have spent your last Euros!!! But overall not a bad stay. I would recommend the hotel but beware of these charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: modpunk
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel very close to all of the key sites. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. We stayed in a city room overlooking the main street and tram line, despite this we had a great nightâ€™s sleep and the noise of the tram was barely an issue. (I didnâ€™t need the earplugs). I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A mistake”
Reviews.Author: ggpublic
Reviews.Content: "The Albus is a well-kept secret, known only by the more experienced and demanding travellers" Come on ! Let's say it straight: - super noisy (the "night kit" we found in our room was a bad sign). If your room is on the street side, you'd betternhave a very strong sleep. The Tram is almost passing by your pillow! - Internet is not wireless everywhere and is not free of charge. 12eur for 24hrs...is this a joke? - booking in advance is not giving you the best price. I booked two months in advance, got one lf the worst room and could have paid 15% less if I had booked 4 hours before travelling to Amsterdam - on that week-end, horrible painting smell on our floor. Reception desk said: "oh really ? Surprising, there was no recent work here. we have to check if anyone is not doing painting in their room" (second joke of the day) - breakfast certainly does NOT worth 19 euros. We randomly headed to a small charming place for breakfast called "Gartine", that was undoubtedly a better choice than this very standard breakfast buffet that we had the first day at the Albus. Bottom line, the marketing words are way over estimated. I won't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: zippiSuperior
Reviews.Content: Recently (31/01/12) spent a night at the Hotel Albus. We arrived early (1100) and due to many checking out at that time our rooms were not ready so we stored our luggage and with the instructions and map provided by the very helpful desk clerk set off sightseeing. The clerk had given us brief instructions on use of the city tram system, which we found very useful and helpful given our ambitious agenda for the day and the temperature outside was quite cold as well (-6 C) for walking. We spent the day touring the Rembrandt House, Anne Frank House, and the Van Gogh museum. All were fantastic and well worth the special stop over we made in Amsterdam following our Mediterranean vacation. We returned to the Hotel Albus at approximately 6 p.m. and our rooms were ready. The desk clerk even assisted helping bring the luggage to our rooms. The rooms are a modern decor, which is generally not to my personal taste as generally I find modernism a cold and sterile environment. However, I found the Hotel Albus decor modern yet inviting, warm, and comfortable. The rooms have coffee makers in each room, which my husband and our traveling partners took advantage of and enjoyed. There was also a complimentary bottle of water in each room. The beds were extremely comfortable with wonderful down comforters. I received the best night sleep of our whole 11 day trip (although the generous dose of fresh air and activity also contributed). I enjoyed the rain shower head despite the lower water pressure, it was novel to me and did the job it needed to do. The heated floors were an extra plus! The hotel lobby also sported a modern decor and due to the cold weather we really appreciated the gas fireplace and the wonderful warmth that was generated. We did take advantage of the 15 minutes free wifi in the lobby to touch base with our work. This was useful, but so many of the hotels that I have frequented now offer free wifi in the rooms without a time limit. Even the old fashioned Hotel Gaudi in Barcelona offered unlimited wifi with a similar boarding rate as the Albus. Not sure if there are differences with wifi installation and charges between the countries that contribute to the difference? There was also an extra charge for breakfast, which we found a bit spendy (19 Euros) and did not partake. Majority of the European hotels we have stayed in always provide the breakfast as part of the room rate. I did peek in the restaurant where the breakfast was provided and it did look nice, but I am not sure if worth 19 euros. The night before we had a fantastic steak dinner at the little Italian restaurant next door for 11.95 euros. We did have drinks in the Hotel lobby bar and the prices did seem reasonable at about 4.50 euros for a nice glass of wine. After check out and requesting a van to take our group to the airport we had not realized that taxi's (esp vans) are not as readily accessible as in other European countries. After a bit of a wait we found out that the van was stuck in traffic and we ended up having to have to regular taxis called to transport as we were not going to make it to the airport within the 2 hour international flight guidelines. Our traveling partners took the first taxi as their flight departed earlier and thanks to the wonderful driver (who arrived 5-10 minutes later) that we had the opportunity to ride with we beat them to the airport! Overall, we had had a very nice stay at the Hotel Albus and I would definitely recommend as a place to stay and would stay again in the future! I hope prior to our next stay that the wifi is upgraded throughout the hotel as wifi is becoming a definite travel need and especially for international and business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: billturnbull
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed our break.Modern hotel with nice room which was well equipped and was very quiet considering city centre location.The bed was particularly comfortable.The staff were very helpful and efficient.Breakfasts were excellent and set us nicely up for the day.Hotel location could not be better for exploring Amsterdam and I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone planning a visit.We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, But Not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Robert78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend, booked the Fashion package which included a quarter bottle of Prosecco (not adequate) and breakfast on one morning which we didn't partake of. The hotel is lovely and staff amazing. So attentive and professional. The room was ok, we upgraded upon suggestion at arrival and we were glad we did as the rooms are small. The main gripes we had were the room service food, (raw burger delivered with blood all over the plate) and more importantly the noise EVERY morning made by the housekeeping staff, from 8am each morning our walls/door shook with the noise of them cleaning, opening the supply cupboard and knocking guests awake to clean their rooms, lets just say, if you wanted a small lie in, it was not possible, - other than that, its a great hotel in a wonderful city. so much to see and do. Shame that each morning we were awoken to incessant and unecessary noise

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good coffee”
Reviews.Author: AnsaFinland
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the weekend in this January, and liked Albus since the location is great. I had booked one of their "smart city rooms", and it was small but ok (I traveled alone). It was quite cold, that must be said. I loved their breakfast - good coffee, huge buffet. It cost about 15 euros, but I would recommed it. Staff was very nice and helpful. BTW, I visited The Cat Cabinet, which is nearby and a must for all the catlovers who visit Amsterdam. And even if I loved that little museum, it isnÂ´t the only reason to visit Amsterdam, there is superb restaurants and great museums.

Reviews.Title: “Not pretentious”
Reviews.Author: SDowie
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here over a weekend in mid january 2012 @79â‚¬/night. I found it on a discount site but then it was cheaper to book on their own website?? I booked their 'smart city room' we got no. 606 which was small but trendy and kind of cool with a little balcony- but it was too freezing to spend much time on haha. The showers are big headed rain showers which is kind of annoying if you are girl and dont want to get wet hair but there was a cap provided. The hotels pretty trendy- I thought they might be a bit posh but the staff were really nice, friendly and chatty, they helped us with bookings, transport, how to get places etc. The breakfast buffet is almost worth the 14â‚¬ prebook, they give you a proper coffee and there is loads to choose from. Maybe im just used to Paris hotels but by comparison this place is cool, clean, friendly, cheapish so I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Disliked it enough to write my first review”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: I'm a positive guy but the experience at the Albus left much to be desired. I stayed on company's dime for 2 night and then one night on my own. First off, I was charged a whopping 159â‚¬, a daylight robbery for what the hotel provides. There is no in-room wireless Internet, but very slow wired Internet is provided with silly cap on Internet use. But Internet costs an additional 11â‚¬. There is decent breakfast (maybe they changed the chef?). But breakfast costs an additional 19â‚¬. (They also wouldn't refund me breakfast I didn't show up for, arguing that "they [breakfast staff] were expecting you". As if the on-demand eggs and extra bacon can't live in the fridge?) You can check out 2 hours late. But that costs 50â‚¬. You can go to the gym. But that'll cost 12.50â‚¬ and it is not even in the hotel building! The rooms are very narrow (you can barely walk past your bed), but their design is nice. The staff was hospitable and about half were competent, except when it came to discussing financial arrangements. Or when it came to cleaning my room after having slept in. On the positive side, the location is excellent for exploring Amsterdam. Even a bit noisy, though the windows seem to block most of that. But for the price I paid I'd expect a good location...

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Location”
Reviews.Author: Elton_DF
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this boutique hotel in November 2011, with some work mates. Very well located, polite and helpful staff, enormous room with several amenities. Place looks brand new and there is a welcoming bar at the lobby where you can rest after a long day of sightseen. Receptionist was kind enough to provide us one extra bed upon late request. In fact we thought we made this clear during reservation process but for some reason there were only 2 beds when we got there. No stress, problem was solved while we were sipping our beer at the bar, sitting by the virtual fire. I would definetly stay there again, preferably with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location in the central of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lani H
Reviews.Content: Albus centrum Amsterdam is in perfect location, in the center of Amsterdam, walking distance to many types of restaurants, easy access to public transportation such as tram, bus and also near the shopping centers, the dam and by easy strolling the area you can find many interesting museums, sight seeing places. I took 2 rooms for me, my husband and my 2 teenager sons. The service overall and the hotel staffs are very helpful and professional, they speak English very well and willing to help. However, I think the room is rather too small even for 2 persons, almost no place to put large luggage bags, which I have 2 for my husband and me and another 2 for my sons. And I don't think the room is suitable for young children who is accessing the internet facility since no free wifi in the room nor the lobby, so we bought the access for the children's room, and apparently the access is also open for adult contents in TV, and could not be separately blocked. The bathroom is ok, however the shower type is not ideal for woman, it's vertical shower typical in men's gym locker and no shower cap is provided, the water is low pressure with large shower head. Even though it's a room for 2, only 1 sandal was provided. other than that, all are perfect. I recommend the hotel for adult travelers or children without having the internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Definitivamente regresarÃ­a”
Reviews.Author: diseï¿½ï¿½adora
Reviews.Content: El hotel esta muy bien ubicado, elegante y bello. Al entrar a mi habitacion, en la pantalla de la TV aparecia un mensaje con mi nombre, dandome la bienvenida. La habitacion estaba muy agradable. Contabamos con nuestra propia cafetera de nespresso en el cuarto asi como alrededor de todo el hotel. Desafortunadamente nuestra habitacion estaba en el sotano, pero eso no nos desanimo. Fue una gran estadia y definitivamente regresaria. El concierge fue de gran ayuda para recomendarnos excelentes lugares para comer.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2011 for 4 nights”
Reviews.Author: humptymcdumpty
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel, staff could not do enough for you. Clean, comfy well located hotel in easy walking distance to tram stops. I have mobility problems and use a stick and coped well. We upgraded to make sure our room was not too small and although it was not the biggest of rooms, it was roomy enough for a city centre hotel. In room internet was via a network connection, not wireless and along with some box office movies, it came in at 14.95 euros for the special offer, which we thought was a reasonable offer . I asked for a kettle as I preferred tea and got one straight away.There is a little street noise, but it is only to be expected as it is in a busy area of the city. Wardrobe space is plentiful - and you can hang your coats on the closet door handles. The in room safe was big enough for the laptop and plenty more. Loads of places to eat and drink all around the hotel if you chose not to eat at Senses.We have been to Amsterdam many times and could honestly say that we would be more than happy to go back to the Albus and recommend it. If you go at Christmas, you'll find Rembrandt Sq just around the corner decorated and lit up as a Winterwonderland with ice skating and lots of stalls selling food and drink to tempt any tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: CW88
Reviews.Content: We visited for a December weekend and The Albus turned out to be a good choice. Our room was a reasonable size and although included enough storage for a couple of days' worth of clothes, there wasn't anywhere to hang our coats. The room was comfortable enough and, with the exception of a small number of minor blemishes, the decor was fine. The bed was comfortable and a good size. The Nespresso machine in the room is a nice touch. The overall feel is of a small and comfortable hotel although we're not sure of the 4 star rating. We found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful. Even with the 25% discount on the breakfast it was still quite expensive although we did struggle to find any other local breakfast options that were open before 8:30. The hotel's location is ideal for exploring the city and there is a variety of good restaurants and bars nearby (the Asian Kitchen is a small Chinese restaurant/cafe a few doors away that serves very nice, fresh food at cheap prices). Overall we enjoyed our weekend in Amsterdam and are happy that we decided to stay at The Albus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Maggie442
Reviews.Content: Our traveling party of 6 recently spent 3 nights t the Albus. The location was terrific, the rooms very clean and reasonably appointed and the staff extremely friendly, helpful and efficient. Our main gripes relate to the fact there was no fridge in the rooms and although there was a coffee machine in each room the majority of our group drank mainly tea and there were no tea making facilities in the room. The hotel certainly provided us with these facilities on request but we were surprised they were not readily available. We found the room quite warm without air-conditioning and needed to open the windows. We did not suffer with mossies but did find it noisy.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel with a few small flaws.”
Reviews.Author: alliec79
Reviews.Content: The Albus is a nice enough hotel and is in a great location. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. However, the room was very dark as we were in the basement and I found 4 bugs in 3 days in the bathroom, I really didn't like that! The room was also noisy during the day (I never could figure out where the noise was coming from) but quiet in the evenings. I wouldn't call this a 4 star hotel, but I suppose it was good enough for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good”
Reviews.Author: HungryandHappy
Reviews.Content: Positives: well located, right on tram line. Friendly, helpful staff. Lovely restaurant in lobby. No health club/ gym in hotel, but discounted rate at great club 5 minutes away Negatives: Health club discounted rate was $12.50 Euro! Rooms small with no room for anything eg not many drawers, cupboards, flat surfaces to put things on. No airconditioning! With windows open, very very loud street noise - shouting, random crashing etc - had to sleep with fan blowing directly on face

Reviews.Title: “Nice Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jadeandjarvis
Reviews.Content: The Albus is a nicely decorated hotel with helpful and attentive staff in a good location for exploring Amsterdam. We had a king size bed and the room was large and attractive. The no air-con was an issue as it was unseasonably warm and there was no fridge either. Perhaps both of these could included as this is a bargain-cheap price hotel. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: john l
Reviews.Content: After a long and exhausting trip arrived in the hotel before check in time. The guy who helped us said that the rooms were not ready yet, so we had to wait till 2 PM. As we waited till 2 PM the room was still not ready.....and still not at 2:45 PM...... As we asked what was wrong, the guy annoyed told us that it was very busy, especially during the summer and those things happened (???). Finally at 3:15 PM we could check in. The room that we got was in the basement!!! No airco and it smelled stuffy!!! As we went back to ask for another room, he got more irritated and said that there was nothing he could do. When we asked we could ask for the manager, he told us he was the supervisor. Some supervisor! We did enjoy Amsterdam, but never the albus again!

Reviews.Title: “Did not take previous reviews seriously enough!!”
Reviews.Author: Holidayfamilyman1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at the albus. Â After reading reviews on tripadvisor thought we would give the albus a try as we were only staying for the weekend & seemed good value at the time of booking. The hotel is located in a very convenient area close to the main center & also the tram line stop. Â As we were only staying for the weekend this became the most important priority for us when choosing a hotel. After reading reviews I had already known that the rooms would not be huge & that there would not be air conditioning. Â This did not bother us as we would not spend much time in the hotel & the weather in october would not be extremely hot either. We arrived at 13:30 & tried to check in early but told the room was not ready. Â This was understandable as the official check in time was at 14:00. Â  The room was modern clean & tidy with very comfortable mattress. Not much space in the room could just about walk around the bed with my shoulders brushing against the wall/plasma tv. Everything seemed ok until our first nigjts sleep.Â Mosquitos were comming in to our room at night & bitting us both all over. As I am writing this review I am still itching from the bites all over. Â Although it was october time, the weather was still too warm for the windows to be closed. Even though the hotel provided fans, this on its own was not enough & windows had to be open. The windows were only opened with a small gap exposed however this did not stop the mosquitos from coming in. Â I recall other reviews complaining about mosquitos but unfortunately I did not take this seriously enough, based on all the bites me & wife received Â I now really regret this. Â  My recomendation to any one thinking of seriously staying in this hotel is to bring plenty of mosquito repellent cream. Â Otherwise look for a hotel with air conditioning in rooms. It is worth the extra premium. Â

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stylish rooms”
Reviews.Author: Letsgo5_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albus in mid-Aug for 3 nights with our teenage kids. First the pros: fabulous location puts you not far from major sites in the city luggage room elevator triple rooms large (for Amsterdam) lobby with seating area bar in lobby for night cap nespresso machines in rooms rain and hand held shower heads comfortable beds very clean tvs have English speaking channels nice decor hotel restaurant room safes cons: only 15 minutes of free WiFi We had a great stay and no real complaints. The front desk staff was professional and helpful. They kept our luggage as we arrived at 8 in the morning while we went sight seeing until the rooms were ready. Someone is able to take help take your luggage up to the rooms. We didn't really need a/c in August and fans are included in the room in case the rooms get stuffy. The rooms are quiet - you can't hear the other guests in their rooms or in the hallway. The great location puts you in the middle of the city so keeping the windows opened while sleeping can make for a noisy night. FYI, there is a movie theater 3 doors down and the hotel is close to the flower market and shopping street. Plus there are lots of cafes and even a McDonalds near by. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of MANIPULATION !”
Reviews.Author: Lina-Omar
Reviews.Content: We had a quick visit to Amsterdam and we stayed in Albus hotel for 2 days on July, 2011 last stop of our Eurotrip before going home ...It was a great Experience, nice room and location until our check out time; when we were surprised by the smoking penalty of 200 Euros! Which we NEVER received a letter or a note regarding it as hotels usually do when leaving any messages; we were only informed about it next day during check out when we were so tight in time for our plane. Having no smoking signs in the room we lighted up a cigarette when an employee immediately came disturbed our time in the room by knocking so loud, even other guests were annoyed by this attitude, so he warned us, we apologized and turn it off immediately. Knowing that no one mentioned the warning during our check in, the receptionist didn't say anything and she manipulated us by asking for our credit card & signature without explaining anything about it, it was our mistake not reading what we signed for but we expected a verbal notice as well when it comes for something essential.as hotel services we expected helpful employees to guide us through the hotels extreme policy (Helping the customer should be number 1 priority at any hotel) We spoke to the person we checked out with regarding this issue for almost an hour, She said that "we apologies for not informing you clearly and not sending a letter to your room thatâ€™s our mistake â€˜â€™. We found out later that an amount of 200 Euros charge on our credit. We sent emails and got replies with no aim to cooperate. We totally understand the hotels point of view; while seems they didnâ€™t want to understand our point of view when we were explaining it, and we all agreed that it was a mutual mistake and misunderstanding, since no one informed us about their non-smoking policy upon check in which was handled by a trainee receptionist, Neither had we received a letter of warning to our room .but still we are paying the penalty!!!!! The point is that the hotel failed to complete the nonsmoking policies correctly toward the guests, by informing every guest about it very clearly upon check in. No compensation from the hotels side and no understanding were shown, they just kept on ignoring their mistake! This is so unprofessional, unethical, with no sense of willing to help!!! It appeared that it was like the hotels aim to get people penalized without guidance and help, only taking advantage with manipulation. We will be visiting Amsterdam again soon but we will definitely choose more understanding, helpful, and willing to take the extra mile to assist any customer.

Reviews.Title: “Looks great, but not idea for business”
Reviews.Author: matthewpaul80
Reviews.Content: The place is cute - it's very modern looking and stylish. That I liked and appreciated. Also, very well located near the palace and tramlines. Not far from the train station, though if you have luggage, best to take the tram. However, just some small things for business travelers. They didn't have an adapter for my laptop (I forgot mine). The in-room internet is one of those TV-Internet combos which is frustrating and time-consuming to use and navigate. They have some internet terminals in the lobby, but not very private or comfortable for working. Lastly, check to see if they have rooms in the back. I had a nice room with a great view on the street, which I thought was quite charming. However, when night fell and the trams rumbled by I wished I were in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AnnetteMc
Reviews.Content: Great location, central to everything, we walked everywhere. Hotel was clean. Rooms are trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: DaronLondon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the centre of Amsterdam. The room was charming, the stuff and the appliances o.k.. We were fortunate to stay in the top floor, but we were pretty unfortunate that the room had no aircon, and it got a bit hot under the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but definitely not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: despinissima
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel in June with my mother, and had booked it over the internet. We arrived to a room which was decent and clean but was at the back side of the hotel, small, dark and looking at a small opening which was the roof of some underneath kitchen or something. This appeared to us a classic case of a hotel where effort has been made to add small things in the decoration of the rooms to make it appear 'design' but which for this simple reason should not have been given a 4* denomination. I kindly asked if we could be given another room, given that I was going to show Amsterdam to my mom and wanted her to enjoy her stay. Staff offered to show me another room, the only available which had a better view but was even smaller! So I said we'd prefer to stay where we were for the night and if they could move us next morning when some of the rooms would have been vacated. The reply to this request of mine was that we should ask them again next morning and that they could not simply take note of this request! On top of everything, for a 4* hotel, the wifi should have been free. In conclusion, clean and decent but for this money I could have stayed somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Cool design, clueless about mosquitos”
Reviews.Author: chiseled
Reviews.Content: great looking place, free wifi means 15 min and then you pay. room pix taken w/ the widest angle camera known to man. 16" btwn bed and closet. Lamps w/ no plugs near them. Bed very comfortable as well as comforter. no air conditioning and bloodsuckers waiting when you open the screenless window. (are window screens some kind of new world invention??) very nice staff, great service. hallways almost unlit, dramatic but thinking they are saving electricityâ€¦ you can barely see to navigate. still, was great location near flower market and restaurants. electrical plugs mysteriously switched off w/ light switches that only work w/door key inserted in themâ€¦ hard to figure out. Fan lowest setting very loud so btwn the 89 mosquito bites and having to close the window in the stifling heat, I'm not sure I'm going back. was us 175. a night tooâ€¦ ouch. have found much better deals.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: crapblabla
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Albus Hotel last week (from Thursday till Sunday), in a Double Delux room and paid around 120â‚¬/night (which was already a discounted price). For a 4Star Hotel it is well BELOW standard! Basic amenities were not given: Breakfast was not included in the price and would have been an extra 13,50â‚¬ (normally 18â‚¬) per person. No mini bar in the room. Only a little Nespresso machine which is nice only if you drink coffee. The wireless internet in the room is NOT free -poor for a supposably 4star Hotel in 2011. wireless doesn't cost a thing nowadays and is a basic service that should be provided by a Hotel. Free internet usage was only possible in the lobby, but one has to get a voucher (valid for 15minutes only) from the front desk. We spent our first night (thursday) in a room towards the front. Even with closed windows it was unbearably loud (dingding-tram noises, motorcycles, screaming drunks). The room which we changed into the next day, was towards the back and very quiet. even a tree was outside of the window, which was nice. The bathrooms are obviously from before the renovations. They looked clean but dated and didn't go at all with the style of the room. The TV menue was very annoying and the phone had no reference on it, how to contact the front desk or the room service. The hallways smelled of old feet and were very very hot. so waiting for the elevator was a drag. On the positive side: The room (towards the back) was nice, chairs were comfortable and the bed (although the mattress was incredibly thin) was comfortable too. The staff was friendly. the location is great and it only takes 10min by tram to the trainstation. To sum up, we would not stay here again! we expect a little more for this amount of money. its not enough to give a room a once over, spray it with modern-style-dust and then charge people up the a.. :-(.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Sharks14
Reviews.Content: We have just returned with friends from a fantastic break in Amsterdam. The Albus was perfect for our stay. Walking distance to all main attractions of Amsterdam with good transport links around the city and to the airport. The Albus was clean and fresh with very friendly and helpful staff. Our room was a reasonable size and perfect for our stay, after all you donâ€™t go to Amsterdam to stay in your room! The usual city sounds could be heard but it is a central location so itâ€™s to be expected, however this did not disturb us. The beds are really comfortable and we had a fantastic walk in shower. I would definitely stay here again and recommend the Albus to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DougalBill
Reviews.Content: Two night stay. We upgraded to the larger room which was light, airy and very comfortable. Service was excellent, polite, friendly and helpful at all times. Thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: eag1611
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the Albus and we were very impressed. Fabulous location - 10-15 min walk to all the main sites and seconds from tram stops making access to Central Station and in turn, Schiphol airport really easy. The Hotel itself was chic, fresh, modern and spotlessly clean. We benefited from a free upgrade so had a very spacious room on the 6th floor which was very quiet for such a city central location. All staff were friendly and helpful. Overall 5/5 and I would definitely recommend to a friend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, excelent location”
Reviews.Author: merav_granot
Reviews.Content: we got to the hotel very easily from the central station. we arrived a bit earlier for check in but the room was ready so we got in right away. in the reception everyone were very nice, helped us with questions about how to get about in the city. the room was amazing, small but full with all you need for a shick vecation: plazma TV screen, internet connection, nespresso machine etc. the staff was very nice, always asked how we were. i would recommend it to everyone who gets to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & friendly service. Great hotel in great location. Will be returning.”
Reviews.Author: DavidWasHere
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a rather disappointing hotel on my previous trip to Amsterdam I was a little concerned about returning. I needn't have worried however, as the Albus took care of me from the moment I stepped through the door. Lovely rooms of a reasonable size and a very nice bathroom (I stayed in a Splendid City King Room). The safe was large enough to store my laptop (A major gripe with the previous establishment). The Nespresso coffee machine in the room was brilliant! Staff were very friendly, welcoming and helpful. The hotel is in a great location within easy walking distance of the city centre and sights - part of the trade-off for this though is that it can be a little noisy outside at nights... Hardly the hotel's fault, but something to consider perhaps if you're a light sleeper? Internet connection was slow, but reliable. RE: The comment about no Wi-Fi in the rooms in the previous review - I've never stayed in a hotel that does provide it (unless it's actually just reached the room from the lounge). Personalised "surprise" gifts were already waiting for me in my room and were a nice touch. Looking forward to staying there again in a couple of weeks time.

Reviews.Title: “Much room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Dre796
Reviews.Content: Good: - hotel is nicely decorated - good location Bad - no WiFi in room - room too small - no airco or heating in room which I think should be a minimum in a 4 star hotel (don't stay here when it's warm or cold in Amsterdam) - when you arrive they tell you that breakfast is included in the price but then they charge 19 euro per day extra for breakfast afterwards (19 euro is also way too much for average breakfast) - they charge around 7 euro a day city taks which is not included in the price

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very convenient for walking Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: saturn77077
Reviews.Content: I booked the Albus because of my corporate discount. But I soon realized it had a great location near the floating flower market, Rembrandtplein, and several tram lines. We had a basic room, nothing fancy except for the large flat screen TV on the wall. Bed was comfortable and there is a small desk and a couple chairs. We did have a few problems with the lamps, TV and windows upon check-in, but the front desk was very responsive which makes up for problems. We had sort of a nice view overlooking rooftops, patios and backyards. It was a little noisy at night. We did sleep with the windows open, since this hotel has no a/c. Keep this in mind if you go during the summer! For a quite nice hotel, I was a little surprised they have not installed a/c. Without the open windows, the room was very stuffy. But back to the positive points - the location was great. Overall Amsterdam is a very walkable city, and we were able to walk many places from the Albus and also get to the tram stops easily. Be sure to visit the floating flower market and try one of the cafes nearby for people-watching. And, there is a McDonalds just up the street from Albus for an inexpensive coffee, breakfast, or a soft drink with lots of ice! :) Try the Indian restaurant around the corner. Very tasty. Just go to Amsterdam and take it all in! The Albus is a great location, but don't plan on spending much time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam - a perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: sukhysingh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel two days ago and it was incredible. from the moment you walk in to the moment you leave, the staff at this hotel will accomdate you anytime they can. As my wife and I were celebrating a special occassion, they even threw in a minature bottle of champagne and personalised greeting. The hotel rooms aren't the biggest in the dam, but they're absoultely top quality and the shower is lovely. If you can get a room with a balcony, it certainly adds the wow factor too! Location wise, it's less than a three minute walk from Rembrandtplein, about 15 mins to the Red Light District and about 12 minutes to Dam Square. Overall, a brilliant hotel and definetly one to stay at if you're Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “My Amsterdam Dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: Waynedad
Reviews.Content: I spent several hours over a 2 week period looking at hotels before choosing the Albus. It was a combination of the location, the claims of a comfortable bed and the in room expresso machine that won me over. It was the staff and the cozyness of the place that I fell in love with once I arrived. The lobby and coctail bar are a combined room and lead into the small dining area that is the Senses restaurant. The restaurant has its own intrance and is good enought to have a customer base that is not made up of hotel guests. It is pricey and the resident chef changes the multi-course special nightly. The one dinner we ate there was awesome. The bed was as advertised and we slept well every night. The curtains are very dark making it easy to sleep late in the morning.(no alarm clock in the room). The bathroom has a switchable outlet for 110V and 220V devices. The shower head is huge and takes some getting used to. There is also a smaller sprayer attached to the tub spout and a retractable wire for hanging cloths. (came in handy the one night we got rained on). The expresso machine was stocked to make 4 cups each day. The staff is what really makes this hotel. From the time we arrived till we walked out the door to leave I felt welcome. All request were met with polite enthusiasm and all of them were fulfilled. Some side notes. there is a small grocery store just south of the hotel and an electronics store just north on the same street. The train station is a 25 min walk from the hotel(if you dont make any wrong turns) We walked from the train station to the hotel when we arrived and took the shuttle on the return trip to the airport. If you like to walk this is the perfect Hotel to see Amsterdam from!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Pickles2011
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, comfortable bed, great coffee and conveniently located. However needs a second lift and larger dining area, common areas are a bit small and can get quite busy.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, items stolen..... worst hotel ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: outof10
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the Albus for two months while relocating with work, I found the hotel dirty and the staff were rude. As my room had no safe, I left my valuables in bags and put away. Still someone in the hotel managed to steal a bracelet and also when my husband stayed for a weekend, somebody with access to the room went through his belongings and took his ipod. Other then the fact thieves clearly have access to the rooms,ever other night I was woken with the fire alarm going off by people smoking in their rooms. This hotel was small, dirty, people who work their steal..... overall an horrendous place to stay. Many of my colleagues in the same situation had terrible things to stay, to the point that people refused to use this hotel. I would not recommend to my worst enemy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Too much hype ,doesnt feel like 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: RUSSIANCOUPLE
Reviews.Content: Impressive: lobby,very polite and helpfull stuff.Very comfortable pillows!! Bad bids:Unfortunatelly room is way too small.No airconditioning and our room was facing main street(party all night)..It was very hymid(had some fan,which wasnt didnt help) in the room and because no aircondition window had to be kept open all night. No ketle in the room(only coffee machine),no spons..All this was supplied on request ,but for 4 star hotel this should be in the room without even mentioning... We will look for alternative next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Noisy rooms, but a lot of potential”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBros
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central and looks newly renovated. The rooms are very small and have to much furniture in. There are gaps under all the doors which make things very noisy - especially from the corridors, and its even more noisy when the cleaning staff start at 9 am on Sundays, talking very loud! People knocking on other doors, the smell of people smoking from their rooms was also disturbing. But on the other hand, the rooms are clean, fresh and modern. We had a balony which was nice but was shared with another room, would be nice to split it somehow with a small fence or plants, and would be nice with a bench or some chairs.... Breakfast was nice, everything you would expect, with good, real barista coffee. Was shocked to hear how expensive the WiFi was, 11,50euros for 24 hours, this is crazy, this should be free for guests, this is 2011! This hotel has so much potential, but needs a bit of adjusting...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: clovertraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in April. We arrived early but were checked in and taken to our room straight away. Staff were helpful at all times, giving advice on transport, tickets, issuing maps with key area highlighted etc. The room was nicely decorated, modern and clean. As it was warm weather so I tried to open the window/door to let in some air but couldn't. On request the hotel staff sorted out the lock which meant it would open. However opening the door meant excess noise from the busy road outside so we had to close it at night to be able to sleep. It did become very stuffy so air con would be welcome. The beds were really comfortable and we slept well - unusual for me when away! The location was great with a tram stop nearby and everything pretty much could be reached by foot. We ate breakfast elsewhere so cant comment on that as there are many places to try - pancakes delicious at Sarah's near Westklerk! Bathroom had large head shower, no bath and is not well set out so would become annoying if staying for a longer period of time. Overall found this a great place to stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly personnel”
Reviews.Author: timpeke
Reviews.Content: Personnel wasn't always very efficient (at the reception), but was very friendly and helpful. Room wasn't very large, but had all amenities and was very clean. Bed wasn't soft enough for my sensitive back. Hotel is located close to city centre. Free guarded bike parking (accessible 08:00 - 00:30) around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: seeohelaye
Reviews.Content: the hotel is really nice, clean and in the city centre. the reception desk service, on the other hand, very inexperienced. the 'problems with the booking system' seem to be an often occurence, as i'd read about it in someone's review previously. we spent at least 5 hours at the reception desk during our stay. also, the moment we arrived, the other desk clerk was charging a protesting elderly man 50 euros for the tv, that apparently automatically activates the payable channels the moment you switch it on. two other annoying things about the hotel are; the very modern but impractical showers, and the incredibly noisy lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Nicer In the Winter”
Reviews.Author: execplatscum
Reviews.Content: Had a chance to take a short break over the weekend to Amsterdam. Location: Very central literally steps from the Flower Market, Short Walk to Dam Square and all the sites, convenient to tram... No issues at all. Rooms: Decent size (although strangely narrow)... comfortable beds.. ok shower with a nice rain showerhead. Included Nespresso machine, Free Water.. decent TV channels. Two issues with the room: 1. Even though it was only 60 F outside, the room heat up a great deal and this Hotel has no AC... none... not in some rooms, not at all. Opening the window would seems to be a good idea but the window is very small and you welcome in a great deal of street noise.. So either suffer in the heat or not sleep well... Those are your choices. If you are in AMS in the summer... Be Aware this place will be HOT! There are plenty of good hotels with AC you can get at the same price. 2. No Wifi in rooms. The front desk will tell you it is for security, but that is clearly non sense in a town where every Mcdonalds has Wifi for free.... They do offer a cable connection but this is slow.. In fact the wireless in the lobby is faster than the wired connections in the room. Breakfast was ok... seemed to be periods when guests could not get in as the dining area was over crowded... they hostess handles this well and offers coffee for those waiting. Overall, breakfast was OK... nothing at all spectacular... Warm Orange Juice, Tepid grapefruit juice... couple of egg choices and some cheese and meat options.. Guest Services: No issues here... decent in all respects..

Reviews.Title: “central”
Reviews.Author: traceyn47
Reviews.Content: very central, near everything, really nice and clean hotel lovely staff and would advise anyone going to amsterdam to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: DeadShotDickie
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amsterdam and was arranged for my husband's birthday. I can honestly say that the service in the hotel was outstanding. Not only did they treat us to champagne, but they even upgraded our room. There knowledge of the area was amazing and they were always more than happy to book tours, airport shuttle buses, recommend places of interest, etc. The style of the hotel is very modern and we just loved it. The attention to detail from the rooms, right through to the pink serviettes and mini flute glasses of fruit juice for breakfast was wonderful. I have already been in contact with our travel agent to thank him for booking with the hotel - he can certainly recommend it to more of his clients. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: LILILX2011
Reviews.Content: You will not regret if you choose Albus Hotel. It's very well situated, you can walk to the main streets or catch a tram in the hotel street. From this hotel you can go to everywhere in a short time. For next time I will choose Albus hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Anna_200581
Reviews.Content: Trip to Amsterdam was a surprise birthday present for my partner (he didn't know where we were going until we got to the airport) so I wanted it to be perfect. And thanks to the wonderful staff in the Albus - it was amazing beyond my expectations. Let me start by thanking Mr Boumann, the reservation agent, who patiently replied to all of my (many...) questions prior to our arrival, and who on arrival presented us with a compliementry bottle of Prosecco, as a welcoming birthday gift - truly wonderful touch. Hotel is beautiful, clean, modern, in a perfect location. Our room was upgraded to the Stunning Suite, and my, stunning it was!! I have travelled a lot, around the world, but this was one of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in. Exactly as you can see on the hotel's website. Especially the bed, so heavenly comfortable we had problems dragging ourselves out of it in the morning. Bathroom was not as modern as the room but perfect nonetheless - I loved the choice of two showers (rainforest and a "standard"one). I didn't hear any noises in the morning. NOT AT ALL. And cleaning staff was there at 10 am, not 7, as the person few reviews down suggests (looking at the date, we were at Albus at the same time). Advice to people who complain about the noise (from the street, trams etc etc) - just don't spend your holidays in the city if you can't put up with the city's noise! Or stay in hotels in the suburbs, not in the centre. Staff at the reception was also lovely, very helpful, ready to answer any querries, always with a smile. I was really sad leaving, this is how welcoming the hotel was. I will recommend it to all of my friends (and anyone who reads this review!) and I hope to be back there in the near future. My partner said it was th best surprise birthday present he could imagine. Big THANK YOU to everyone at Albus.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to saty”
Reviews.Author: nrees69
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 4 day break in Amsterdam and stayed at The Albus. I would recommend the hotel to anybody. The location is excellent, the hotel staff extremely helpful and the rooms very clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a quiet but central location”
Reviews.Author: Kelly87free
Reviews.Content: A mixed group of friends stayed for a long weekend. The hotel staff were great, the bed was the most comfortable one I have ever stayed in! Breakfast was very nice even handed out shot glasses filled with fruit smoothie. The coffee machines and bathrobes in the room were all nice little extras. You can get the tram from just outside the hotel but it doesn't take too long to walk to the central station either.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatble quality/Price”
Reviews.Author: Dariosh
Reviews.Content: Good Service, Good Rooms, Good Price, really i can't complain about nothing!

Reviews.Title: “meh”
Reviews.Author: getmeouttaherrr
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Messed up our reservation (reserved a month and paid in full in advance) sent us across the street the first night to carlton hotel and put us in the Bellini room (70's glam apt suite, old but fun (ny)) side note- cleaners forget to takeoff someones already chewed gum stuck to the wall beside the bed, eww gave us free breakfast buffet for both mornings, yummy! - caters to allergies -except for dairy, i had orange juice on my cornflakes instead gave us a king size suite in the albus on the second night. not bad. we purchased internet and full tv/movie/music package for 14 euros best deal we came across ...i liked that option !! -the "rain shower" was terrible! impossible to get the temperature right, kept fiddling with hot and cold handle, bath tub was clogged and filled up with boiling hot water so i couldnt even stand in the shower after i did manage to get the temp. right, had to run it cold and swish it around until it was warm, then back to getting the temp right. after literally 15 min i jumped in for a quick shower, then out. bathtub drained after a few hrs, and my boyfriend didnt shower that night, because showering in someone elses filth is disgust. -the nightlight above the bed was broken and hung loose, when we tried to move it, it sparked....we had them come up and they taped it to the wall to get it out of the way, eek should have got that travel insurance after all... -upon check out we stood waiting in line patiently until it was our turn, for about 20 min, there were only two people being helped (1 grp. for each person working) seems simple enough, but when it came to our turn, the receptionist told us we had to wait while he showed the grp up to their room....hmmm wait, what?? when he realized our sad faces he asked us what we needed, and after that it was a matter of a minute we were checked out and rid of this Albus disaster. I would say I have mixed feelings about this place because although they messed everything up with their unorganized, terrible service....we benefitted quite well. meh.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Manchester2006
Reviews.Content: Great Location - Very central Very Polite staff Modern and clean in the lobby / reception "However" the ROOMS........... Tiny rooms Walls paper thin - you can hear 'absolutely' everything in the next door rooms doors banging all night we were on the first floor room at the back - facing a wall, open the window and all you could see was a mass of cigarette butts dropped from the windows of the rooms above Very basic and poor standard shower room dirty / scuffed walls everywhere Housekeeping banging around from 7.30am spoke to reception about changing the room and was just told that they were full!! No other option! If you want a good nights sleep do not stay here

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at The Albus.”
Reviews.Author: redpetalsmile
Reviews.Content: I searched through lots of accommodation options in Amsterdam and couldn't find anything I liked for our budget until I came across The Albus. I am so glad that I decided to book it. It is in an excellent location few minutes walk from Rembrantplein, the Flower Market and the main high street shopping area, and a short walk to the Museum District and to centre around Dam square. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, the hotel is nicely decorated with a cute bar area and adjoining restaurant. I can't comment on the food, we decided not to take breakfast there was I thought it was a little on the expensive side (as are all 4* hotel breakfasts). However, the restaurant seemed very popular in the evening. Overall the room price was great for the standard of the hotel compared to other options I looked at Amsterdam. The room was spacious, clean and nicely decorated, with large rain shower in bathroom and a little mini living area. We had a room facing the main road, so the only slight downfall was it was a little noisy with traffic noise, but I would expect a little noise being in a city centre hotel. The beds were so comfy that we slept very well anyway. Overall, great location, super friendly staff, nicely decorate and good ambience, good value for money. Would stay there again and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel,Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: staceyj82
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on wed 23rd, around 6pm, check in was very quick, staff very friendly and wished me a happy birthday! Upon arrival to our very spacious room, we found it clean and warm, also a little birthday gift had been left for me which was lovely! The pillows on the bed were quite possibly heaven sent. The shower was also very nice! We had no problems with noise but we do have two young children!! Only problem i would say was that the room was a little stuffy when sleeping but i always sleep with a window open, was very novel waking up to the sound of trams and the city coming alive!! Will def stay here agin!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated lobby and rooms, dark eerie corridors and a drippy shower!!”
Reviews.Author: Goon79
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, nicely decorated lobby, however once passed here the corridors are very dark and quite eerie. The key card had no indication which way up or round it goes in the door which led to several minutes of frustration only to find out it didn't work in the first place. The room was nicely decorated and a free safe is always a bonus. The walls of our room were thin and despite being at the far end of the corridor it was still very noisy during night and day. The most frustrating part of our stay was every time a door banged shut in the corridor it would jolt the shower into a dripping frenzy which led to an uncomfortable nights sleep. Whilst mentioning the shower it also ran cold several times (and there were two of them in one bath tub!?!) The room was quite stuffy and this during the winter without the heating on. Despite this the hotel staff are very friendly and most accommodating and provided us with a secure room in which to leave our luggage having several hours to kill after we had checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Walls are thin like wafers, totally not soundproof, Bathroom is very basic.”
Reviews.Author: Patzypatz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I has picked this hotel due to the good photos we saw, reviews and location. We had quite a few options for hotel but somehow ended up picking this one. Came over to spend 2 nights for Valentine's day. As we're only here for short 3 days 2 nights and my boyfriend hasn't been to Amsterdam before, therefore, I've planned quite a busy schedule for us to see the most out of Amsterdam within those 3 days. Arrived Amsterdam Centraal around 12, as we know, check-in is at 2pm, therefore, we walked around sightsee abit with our luggage to kill time and have lunch. Went into the hotel to check in at 210pm, expect the room will be ready. But disappointingly, receptionist staff said our room is not cleaned yet due to the previous customer has checked out late and they're busy to clean all other rooms. Which wasn't a good start as I expect to quickly get ready in the room and go out and spend the rest of our day sightseeing. We ended up sitting in the lobby to reschedule or plan since we've lost another hour or so. Ended up our original plan was ruined because 2pm the room wasn't not ready. We didn't get to have our room til nearly 245pm!! Perhaps for some, an hour or so, not make any difference, but when you've a tight schedule to see and do the most, it's a lot. We've booked a smart city room and I've been trying to find out before we arrive if bath-tub is included or not as we do fancy a nice bath after a long day out. Even had an email respond saying bath-tub is available in some smart-city rooms. So when we check in, we asked for one, but ended up, the staff said we'll have to pay 10EUROS extra per night for that kind of upgrade. We didn't take it as most times we're not gonna be in the room anyway, but just a pitty charging extra if you want bath-tub as well. Mind you, they couldn't give us a room on time for a start then still want to charge 10Euros extra if we want a room with a bathtub. Kind of disappointed service. Most other hotels if things like this happen, would be offering us the room with a bathtub since the room was free and available and rather than keeping the customer unhappy and waiting in the lobby for their designated room to be cleaned. Bad start - then when we walk into our room, was shocked, how small it's compare to the photos we've seen. At least the room is nicely decorated and comfy bed and pillows. The room was so dark, as there's no ceiling lights, only 2 bedside lamp which you can move it up and down but 1 of them the cable was lose, only on in certain angle. The table lamp doesn't even work!!!! So we only had the 2 bedside lamp and the dimlights from the back of the TV wall. VERY DARK indeed. It's still daylight, and our room was at the back, even had all the curtains open, still dark! Bathroom - I should say SHOWER ROOM instead. VERY BASIC - like some people were saying, the bathroom/shower-room certainly doesn't match with the rest of the room as the room is modern contemporary style, but bathroom is very basic standard! Worst thing about the bathroom/shower-room is, there's NO HOOKS to hank your towels or clothes. The only hook is behind the door, which there's already a bathrobe hanged and also the door isn't technically close to the shower is. So if you hang your towel there, you'll have to walk a few steps to get your towel when you're soakingly wet. Of course no hooks to hang the hand towels. The only place you can hang your towels besides the door hook is the rail above the toilet, which is extremely stupid to put it there because all the towels were original placed over there, and 2 hand towels on top of each other. When I pull 1 hand towel off, the other one also slide and guess what.. drop straight into the toilet!!!! Embarrassing to say, it NEVER HAPPENED to me in my entire life of travelling! They really should invest some money on improving their facilities in the bathroom/shower-room. The shower also is very annoying. It's nice to have a head shower, but, it's fixed and there's no other way of getting water from the shower besides from the top of your head. Walk in shower without door or anything just half blocked by the wall, the water still splashed everywhere, makes it very wet and messy on the floor. We already opened the window, and the steam from the shower, just stays in the shower-room for ages! when I say ages is at least good half an hour or even longer. Ended up I have to clear the mirror with towels! Perhaps installing fan in the bathrooms will be ideal too. Lights again in the bathroom is very yellow and dark as well. So after a long day out and back to the hotel ready to sleep at 1030pm - thought we will just drop dead and sleep like a baby til morning. WRONG! First the next door irresponsible Spanish tourists - been so so so loud and noisy for good hour or so, the noise sound so abnormal, then we went outside to check, their door was wide open, and we've noticed, it's not some party nose. We did not exactly see what happened but there's few people in the room, banging, screaming and smacking someone. Then we've noticed someone was drug overdose. Either was passing out or dying whatever that is. We had our TV on still can hear them so loud, got to a point we want to sleep, but they're just getting louder and louder. We called reception - the staff was polite, but obviously knows something going on, and said next door someone is very sick, waiting for ambulance. We're dying for the ambulance to turn up and take that irresponsible disturbing neighbour away from us. The whole incident was a good 2 and a half hours long until it goes quiet. Alleluia.. as we slowly fall asleep.. me and my boyfriend were taking turn waking up by some knocking sound, banging sound throughout the night. Perhaps is Valentine's night, you expect people will be up for some romance. I must say, Albus hotel walls are seriously thin like wafers. Never stayed in any hotel that you can hear noise all night long which isn't coming from outside the building. Can hear people walking on corridors either outside our room/upstairs/downstairs. Knocking or Banging whatever on the wall and strangely the noise do pass from the back of your head on the wall. As if you're wearing some earphones surround sound keep hearing knocking. Strange thing is our room is the last room at the end of the corridor which there's no right hand side neighbour. But the sound sounds like it's from the right hand side of the room. Kind of creepy as we thought, it's the end of the building and not attached to another building, where is the knocking come from? some kind of ghosts? lol. That's how bad it's about the walls in this hotel. My boyfriend woke up 3 times in the middle of the night thinking someone was knocking on our door. I woke up 6-7 times throughout the night because I just couldn't stand anymore. TERRIBLE night! DID NOT SLEEP well and much at all, waking up feeling worse than not having any sleep. Doesnt even matter how comfy is the bed and pillow anymore. It's all these noise killed our night. Then we thought shall we ask if we can change room for our 2nd night. But then we've unpacked our stuff, will be annoying to pack and unpack again since it's just 1 more night and also we dont have all day, on tight schedule as a tourist. If we stay more than 2 nights we would of asked to change to another room. So we thought forget it, perhaps, it won't be as bad on the next night. Which was better than 1st night, but still some knocking noise throughout the night. Like some people were mentioning - breakfast not included and they gave us 25% off if we want to purchase breakfast but it's such a rip off, cafes, mcdonalds are just few steps away, not worth taking breakfast here. Saying it's a 4* hotel, internet is not included which's disappointing and it's so crazily expensive is another ridiculous thing. We've regretted choosing Albus Hotel as we could of pay the same money for same convenient location, same standard, include breakfast and free wifi. Sound is another thing which maybe other hotel will still have the same issues. But at least you get more out of your money after all. Tourist like us in a tight schedule needs a good night sleep which this hotel didn't give us at all. Having said about all these negative things. I also want to say some good things about this hotel to end my review - 1. Nespresso coffee machine in the room - can't get any better in a hotel room!! 2. Location is fairly central which going to anywhere is just walking distance. Saving money and time for transport! 3. Lobby is modern, nicely decorated. 4. Room is very clean. That's all the positive points I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel on perfect location”
Reviews.Author: vanKessel
Reviews.Content: Very nice and beautiful hotel. Completely renovated and refurnished. Everything was very new, but most important everything was very clean. The rooms are spacious en and comfortable. And you have your own nespresso machine in your room (for free!) The location is simply perfect, also for the night life of Amsterdam We had diner in the also renovated restaurant Senses in the hotel. A thing you must try. We had the 5 courses chef's menu. Best meal ever in A'dam.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Albus”
Reviews.Author: maf-9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very central, 2 min from the floating flower market and the closest tram stop, 5 min from Rembrand square. The staff was very polite and checking in and out was very quick. The room was clean and spacious with modern and comfortable furniture. We loved the cow patterned stool! They had two complimentary water bottles for us the day we arrived and the room was also equipped with a nespresso machine. The bath was large and clean, not as modern as the room but very nice and functional. We had a room at the 5th floor with street view, which was a bit noisy. It did not bother us but light sleepers should rather ask for an inside room. In general it was a very nice hotel, very good value for money and we would certainly return. If ti had free wifi it would have been just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: JinDXB
Reviews.Content: If in Amsterdam for leisure you can't go wrong with the location. Central and 10 minutes walking distance from anything! Rooms are well appointed, clean and definitely good value for money. My partner and I booked a room with double bed which was smaller (and cheaper) than the twin bedded room... no big deal as we only stayed 2 nights but for longer stays next time we will book a twin room. Helpful, professional and smiling staff met in all areas. Only tried the breakfast during our stay....good selection and quality of food! We definitely recommend it and will book again for our next trips to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EthelLancashire
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Albus for 3 nights Bed & Breakfast inbetween Xmas and New Year. The hotel is excellent and I would definately recommend. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was very clean. The breakfast had everything you could want and the quality was good.

Reviews.Title: “Chic in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: kiara_renee
Reviews.Content: Very cute rooms- quite small, but thats what you expect in Europe! Friends of ours upgraded their room, which was much bigger- so if you need some sitting space, then pay the extra. Spotlessly clean, comfy beds. Loved having the nespresso machine in the room- just awesome. The flat screen TV was great, and they even personalised it to greet us when we came into the room. We didn't have breakfast included, so can't comment on that, but we did order room service, which was quite good. The location is just opposite the flower market, and only 2 mins walk from the tram, so really easy to get everywhere. Overall, thought it was great- and I would definately stay here if I returned to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful and a smart hotel.”
Reviews.Author: katieguerrini
Reviews.Content: Close to main attractions, but no where near the red light district, a quiet and peaceful hotel. Massive beds too.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Abuja, Nigeria until I move back to the UK
Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: abujanprincess
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel without knowing anything about Amsterdam or the hotel's location - and got a very pleasant surprise.
