The welcome was very warm - the upgrade to an even better room on arrival was fantastic. The room was very clean, the linens were very clean too. The room was an excellant size (stunning city suite), the safe really is big enough for your computer (with room to spare). Bathroom was clean with no signs of mildew etc. Location was fantatic - easy walk to places like: Anne Frank House, The central train station, and the other major museums and shopping areas. Staying at new year was lovely - I especially liked the complimentary Oliebollen on the reception desk in the mornings - Yum. The little touches are very important. The rooms were blissfully quiet eventhough the hotel has a city centre location. Reception staff were very helpful and I could not fault them. All in all a fantastic small hotel for a short stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: ps51
Reviews.Content: This small modern hotel is simply great. Location is excellent - 2 mins walk.distance to Kalverstraat shopping area and 10 mins to Dam square. Room was newly decorated, spacious and clean with nice furniture. Good quality breakfast, efficient to begin our day. Hotel staff always kind and helpful. Really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for few days”
Reviews.Author: unvisigoth
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel near the centre. Room small but confortable. Staff very kind. It should be good more control on room temperature (very high). I've been there for three nights. Perhaps for longer period the room is too small. But for few days is good. Not cheap but the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Lrikaki
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Albus during our annual visit at the Amsterdam Documentary Festival we asked for a calm room and the room was indeed calm overlooking a small garden at the back side of the hotel The room was very clean and warm We had free internet access as we had requested Internet speed was very efficient A nespresso coffee maker was a nice surprise in the room as we are nespresso fans! Breakfast had satisfying choice Staff were very helpful and friendly As we stay every year in Amsterdam this was the first time we tried th Albus and it is a far best choice than all hotels we have tried before in the area Good value for money We will return! and we have recommended the hotel to many of our friends that do to the festival and have trouble finding good services at other Amsterdam hotels The only problem is that during restaurant hours especially at dinner time there was a very strong cooking smell coming form the restaurant that invaded the whole reception area which made it unpleasant to stay at the nice lobby This is a pitty indeed! I am sure this can be fixed

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, superb bed, large rooms as for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sunfloo
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is perfect for a tourist, the beds are very comfy, stuff - helpful and polite. Little complimentary drinks also make good impression. The breakfast could have been better. I am not a light sleeper so I haven't heard the noise mentioned in previous reviews. I had a very good stay in this hotel and plan to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trockie
Reviews.Content: I agree with others about the fact that it can be noisy, however I frequently encounter this in city hotels in Europe. My solution is, if you are a light sleeper, wear earplugs. It comes with the territory. No big deal. I thought the hotel was great and reasonably priced. Modern, awesome coffee machine in the room- Nespresso and wood floors, which I really like at a hotel. The only things I would have changed would be for them to include breakfast & internet, but if they did the price would likely increase as well. A good compromise would be to add a small refrigerator in the room. It is convenient to the trams and I even walked down to the Central train station a couple of times. It is in a convenient location for sightseeing. The staff is terrific. They were friendly and as helpful as possible. I will definitely stay there again if I return to Amsterdam, which may happen this week.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - rooms on the small size”
Reviews.Author: Sissy55
Reviews.Content: You really cannot fault the location of this hotel. it is right in the middle of everything and we walked to all the main sights. We booked a "splendid city room - best deal" through Expedia and for three nights the cost was Â£310 - quite pricey for a double at this time of year. The room had all that was needed but was really tiny and the lighting is not so good. Breakfast was expensive so we did not bother as the hotel is so close to the flower market and there are loads of little cafes offering much better value for money. The staff were most helpful - umbrellas for the rain, booking transfers to the airport etc. There are a couple of floors with executive rooms - well worth investigating, given our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable - but need to address lack of soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: levieenrose
Reviews.Content: Good centrally located hotel. We arrived by car and although we had done plenty of research regarding parking we were unable to find out the parking rates. I think the hotel should give an indication of the parking charges as this adds a considerable amount of 45 EURs per day to the stay! Breakfast adequate but overpriced. Room was clean and comfortable. First night stay was spoilt by inadequate soundproofing and having noisier than average neighbours which meant we didn't get much sleep. We contacted reception and they did speak to the noise makers but it didn't help much. Next day we complained at reception and they moved us straight away to a room at the back of the hotel which was better. Rather oddly, it would seem that the doors in both rooms didn't seem to fit the door frame properly and this meant that noise permeated from the corridor into the room. Hotel lift is far too slow.

Reviews.Title: “It's alright... not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: alfredunhill
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. But the building walls are too thin, that I can hear clearly the tv next room and people walking outside. Management are yet to be improved, such as baggage storage service is one of the least secured practise among the hospitality industry. They simply led me to their baggage storage room, opened the door and allow me to put my bag onto the rack by myself. Without any receipt or ticket, I simply requested the front desk staff to enter the storage room when I was back, went inside and took my (or someone else if I felt like to!) bags and go. Staff had already walked away before I came out, and only if I were nice enough to help them close the storage room door. Also a little bit disappointed on my request of having a 2pm check out which required a sucharge of 50 euro (60% of my room charge per night). I told the nice lady manager I have to be leaving by 1-ish, as I need to catch up my flight, but she kindly offer me to stay until 1pm without charge. I felt like making a bargain at the flea market! I didnt mind to have a strict NO, but the bargaining part sounds cheap to me. This lack of flexibility is also not too competitive among the hospitality industry, as most hotels in town can offer a 2pm check out on request. As said, if availability is not affordable, a strict no would not be a problem instead of a flea market bargaining!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, ok price”
Reviews.Author: WorkTravlerUS
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of the hotel, it was easy to walk to many of the tourist sites and great shopping. The city is beautiful and historic in this area. We had a room with a king and single bed and this seemed to be the most affordable option for the two of us at 200 euro. It included decent breakfast. The only complaint I have is that the room was on the street side so it was loud at night. We were so tired from walking that I slept just fine anyway (I am a light sleeper) but I would request a room not on the street. We arrived by train to Amsterdam and easily caught a tram right outside to the hotel. I would stay here again. Staff were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: bInglis
Reviews.Content: 4th tram stop from Central Station, easy to find. Hotel reception modern, friendly, helpful staff. Efficient check in. Even with 5 customers arriving on different days, I felt sure my complicated booking would be a mess, but they had no problems with it. Only one elevator, so if it is busy you will have to wait. Rooms are modern, comfortable and clean. Great shower, very important... Bar is not as expensive as you would expect. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: baruti
Reviews.Content: Nice room and location. Service was terrible. No concierge. The desk staff were useless.

Reviews.Title: “First Impression Not Good”
Reviews.Author: milo1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights at this hotel with our daughter. On arrival the staff were unwelcoming and busy. We were given a room in the basement which was furnished nicely but smelt old and damp. Because we were below the road level we could not open our windows to get fresh air or better natural lighting. Two fans were supplied to keep the room cool. Not happy at all we complained to the receptionist who informed us that the hotel was full and could do nothing about it until the next day. Our first night was not good here and the room was not ideal if you should feel claustrophobic. However the next day we were given a another room upstairs which was much nicer and lighter and the staff seem to be friendlier and accommodating. All I would suggest here is that when you book a room at this hotel just inquire as to where you will be placed. Otherwise Amsterdam was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the young, just not for kids.”
Reviews.Author: ReneeVit
Reviews.Content: Central and clean but thin walled which made evenings interesting. We were traveling with a two yr old and had trouble at night with the noise levels in adjacent rooms. I would recommend it for young couples who want to be central and who don't mind the lack of amenities. Wifi is not free so bring your laptop if you can. Head down the street for bagels instead of the over-priced hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay. Staff couldn't have been more helpful”
Reviews.Author: JENKS21
Reviews.Content: I would recomend the Albus highly. The rooms were excellent and the staff were very helpful. The location is also very central.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious family room- very close to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: ThorCanada
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a great location--close distance to all attractions but away from the business of the Damplein. We stayed here for 4 nights--we travelled with our two small children. The family room was incredibly large--an L-shaped room which allowed the kids' beds to be "around the corner" from us...They provided a sofa bed for one child and there was still room for a single cot for the second. If you can believe it, we still had tons of room for our luggage and to move around. Very freshly renovated decor and huge bathroom. All rooms have a Nespresso machine and a healthy selection of espressos to choose from. Staff were most helpful and accomodating. Didn't try the restaurant. There is a charge for internet but the connection was good. Would highly recommend this hotel, especially for families as it is so difficult to find rooms that are large enough for 4 people without falling over one another.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby ... Shame About the Rest”
Reviews.Author: firbolg
Reviews.Content: The Albus is obviously an old hotel that's been given a facelift. The lobby and communal areas have been refurbished to look more boutique chic but with mixed results. The corridors for example are all painted and carpeted in purple which makes the place just far too dark. And the bedrooms, while nicely finished, are very small and very hot with no aircon and awkward windows. But the biggest drawback has gotta be the breakfast, which they're charging (but not openly advertising) â‚¬18pp for. Pretty outrageous really and makes me have to give this place the thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant surprise - top value in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DannyM77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Albus earlier this month. En route to Antwerp, following 5 nights camping in Northern Holland, we needed a comfortable base to enjoy Amsterdam for a night. I booked the previous day using wotif.com, and was frankly astonished to find a double room (exc. breakfast) for 74 Euro. As such I wasn't expecting much, especially as the location is so central. Surely the hotel photos couldn't be accurate? We checked in early at 11am and were immediately given the key to our room. My first impression was that the room was very similar in style and size to that of City Inn hotels in the UK. Freshly refurbished, stylish decor, great bathroom - large, spotless, superb shower. Extras: espresso machine, TV internet (4.95 Euro for 24hrs) generous with the complimentary toiletries. We didn't take breakfast, but free tea and coffee was on offer at reception for guests - so why spend 18 Euros? We walked from Central Station (trams go right past the door) so it's a great central location - 5 minutes to the Jordaan as well as all the usual tourist traps. Our view was on to the busy main street, but I didn't have any issues with noise during the night. All in all - a great value experience and a very pleasant surprise. Definitely recommended and will be on the top of my list for next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: JaneSmileyUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 3 day break. Booked on late rooms for about 90 Euros. Location was perfect, staff excellent and recommend to anyone. Didn't eat there so cant comment about the food. Fantastic expresso machine in the room which was a nice touch. The room was a bit small but bed and bedding were very comfy. Good internet / tv package for 15 euros, dont really like paying extra for internet but I knew from the start so included it in the price. Bathroom was fine but no bath (not that I wanted a bath) and lighting in the bathroom was not the best (but that was just a girl thing!) There was only 1 lift and it was very slow but hey, dont worry about that, stay there, it is great for a short break!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: georgex999
Reviews.Content: Yup, just like everyone says, the location is perfect. A great value if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “dont hesitate to book this hotel, fantastic , great value, location brilliant”
Reviews.Author: benny2
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, we stayed here around 10 years ago so we knew the location was great but as renovations are well under way we were upgraded to the apartment. Having never been upgraded before we were absolutely delighted. The apartment has its own front door so we rarely entered the hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly and always courteous and helpful. i was very impressed at the standard of the apartment , beds really comfy and internet via ethernet cable supplied by the hotel for 8 euros for the entire stay. Good having a kitchen and dishwasher and a downstairs toilet , Dont hesitate to book , the rooms will be of the same high standard, We did nt have breakfasts but the menu looked good and not too expensive. Thank you Albus grand if we return to amsterdam we will use you again

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: ssmak
Reviews.Content: Within a walking of Station Amsterdam Centraal, Heineken Experience, Museums and various entertainment areas, Albus Grand Hotel is wonderfully located. We arrived quite early on our check-in day and with 30 minutes (and a 20 Euro a night room-upgrade) we were in our room. There were no amenities in the room, however, around the corner are some drugstore/pharmacy type shops. Our room was clean and spacious with reliable wireless internet and a view of bustling Vijzelstraat.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuloola
Reviews.Content: I went to amsterdam with my boyfriend, we had a great time and would go back asap! We stayed the Albus Grand-Hotel which was a nice enough hotel and our room was nice but the only thing i didnt like about the room was it was tiny!! consisted of a double bed, wardrob,desk and 2 side tables and very little room to move about! Bathroom was fine, small aswell but bright and clean. I would try another hotel if i went back but wouldnt cross this off my list.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RJ777
Reviews.Content: The Albus grand is in an amazing location, its about 10 mins walk to the museum square and about 10-15 mins walk to Anne Franks house/Dam Square/red light district. You are 5 mins away from Rembrant Square which as a few nice eateries and bars. We did not need to get traims or bikes anywhere. If you are arriving to Amsterdam by air, you can go to the connexions desk in the arrivals hall where for 24.50 EUR return, there is a shuttle bus that takes you to the hotel and return. There is information on that on the hotel website. We booked the hotel as a package incl flight through easyjet, for about Â£219 PP not including breakfast - but there is plenty of choice for food walking around the city so this was not an issue. We had a deluxe room as there were 3 of us staying, the room was very big and quite clean - despite cigarette burns in the quily cover. There were tea and coffee making facilities which were reguarly topped up, and the amenities were good - some nice aloe vera body lotions etc. The only things that were wrong with the room was the shower kept going hot and cold, one of the lights flickered on and off a lot even though the bulb was fine and it was very warm at night even with the window open. But otherwise I was impressed with the room, there was a nice table and chairs to sit on. There is building works on at the moment, and despite saying the work began at 10am to minimise noise disturbance, it started more 9:25ish - we were usually up at about 8:30 anyway but on the last day we allowed a lie in and it was too noisy for this. The staff were friendly at check in and provided us with a map - we had lots of amsterdam leaflets in our room too which was good - They were helpful when we asked for more tea and coffee and booked our shuttle bus for our return. We did not have to speak to the staff much but I get the feeling they would have been helpful with any queries we had. Overall, I would reccoment this hotel for the spacious clean rooms, the absoultely AMAZING location, and the assistance of the staff - the minor problems with out room may well be related to the bulding work that they are doing and may not be a permanent problem.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with good service.”
Reviews.Author: luke1951
Reviews.Content: Great loacation especially for those who are going to sample the amsterdam culture the nearest coffee shop is just round the corner as is resturants and bars and the start of the main shopping area is two miniutes walk away.There is some work taking place in the lobby in the day time but it did not affect us besides its not like there isnt better places to spend your time all in all it was fine for what we wanted and will be going back i think the main reason is that the hotel is so close to everything but its not so close that you have sleepless nights from the noise of the city and BEWARE of the bicycles there everywhere.!! 18th-20th

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: holiday89Wales
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Excellent location, near all the local attractions. Just behind the hotel is rembrant square where you can get a tram. In the square are plenty of restraunts/bars and coffee shops to choose from. The hotel is on the main road, we had a room at the front of the hotel which i found quite noisy at times. We had food in the restraunt one evening, it was lovely, but a little expensive. All in all a nice hotel, staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalistic but nice”
Reviews.Author: Peanut-NL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for visiting the heart of Amsterdam. Pros: cleanliness, quiet room, very friendly and professional staff. Cons: no window to open (room did have a door to a small balcony, shared with several others and at street level). Business trip, so I had booked a stay with network connectivity, which was at a much more reasonable price than some other hotels charge for connectivity. After much testing, they finally admitted that the room in question does have an ethernet socket but no working connection, isn't even listed in their control system to switch it on. They then did offer me another room then, but I didn't feel like wasting even more time and finished my work using the free lobby wireless. Also, they don't seem to have non-smoking rooms: I asked for one, and they said they'd give me one, but the room didn't have 'No Smoking" signs and did have an ashtray. Fortunately it didn't smell of smoke at all.

Reviews.Title: “Albus Grand- How a hotel should be run!”
Reviews.Author: bubskj
Reviews.Content: Well, where should I begin? We booked this hotel as my brother had stayed here before and highly recommended it. We booked a quad room. and were not disappointed one bit. For a start, we arrived there at 11am, and the staff were more than happy to check us in. We then found out that we had been given a deluxe room at no extra cost- which meant we could also take advantage of the hotel's wi-fi(from our room) for free. The location is excellent, and we didn't have to take a cab once. There are plenty of tram stops dotted around the hotel so transport was never an issue. Anyway, it was only a 10-15 min walk to Dam Square. Also, the staff were great- always happy to help with whatever was needed. The room itself was clean, spacious, and in great condition- lots of storage space too. The only negative thing I would have to say about it is the same as some of the other reviews- the breakfast was pretty expensive so we never chose to eat there. But I can live with that as there was never a shortage of food shops. Overall, I would say that this hotel had exceeded all of my expectations, and would not hesitate to go back there again, or to recommend it to someone else. Well done Albus Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Albus, very good but the breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: hkoyster
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very large and comfortable. Hotel was very clean and central (near flowers market). Staff was helpful. Everything immaculate, room rate was ok but .. be aware of breakfast, not included on room rate. That was something expensive. I think 16 euros were too much. I would anyway come back in this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, dont be put off by silly reviews!”
Reviews.Author: boohoo123
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and couldnt really find a fault with it. We had an early flight into Amsterdam and arrived at 10am, but staff allowed us to check in straight away. Our room was perfect and extremely clean, including the bathroom which had a huge corner bath and shower. Our room overlooked the main street, which was very noisy at night. We did ask to move rooms but only a smoking room was available for the second night so we chose to stay, and slept a lot better on the second night. Staff were extremely helpful and pleasant, and we really couldnt fault the service we had. Location is great, right next to bars, clubs, plenty of restaurants. The flower market is just across the street along with a variety of shops and department stores. I find some of the previous reviews for this hotel a bit ridiculous and cannot understand why people have rated it so badly. Our room was perfectly clean and we had no problems at all. Staff were fantastic and the level of service we received was outstanding. We had a fantastic time and would not hesitate to go back, but next time we would ask for a quieter room towards the back of the hotel! We also had a late check out until 2pm which was 20 EURO extra, and I believe we were charged around 4/5 EUR for city tax.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but feels like roughing it”
Reviews.Author: Mary-EllenCallahan
Reviews.Content: There for 2 night/3 days, the sheets were not changed, the towels were frayed and smelled, the toiletries were not restocked and the room was not vaccumed. Suffice it to say, housekeeping is not the strong suit. Breakfast was mediocre, especially for 16 euros. What it does offer is a convenient location - not far from Amsterdam Central station and within walking distance of many restaurants and shops. The friendly staff was also a plus. But when you're paying for a comfortable place to stay away from home, this is not it. Felt much more like "roughing it".

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: weegee88
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading good reviews about it and from viewing the pictures on the internet. Upon arrival we checked in very promptly, the reception gave us a good impression but when we opened the door to the room it was like we were in a different hotel! It was very outdated, dirty carpet and a dirty/mouldy shower curtain hanging in the shower room (no bath!). Our room had a balcony which we shared with next door - the tiles on the floor of the balcony were broken and it was very unsafe! The beds were very uncomfortable as they were two single beds pushed together and I'm not sure if the linen was changed as it made me itch! There was no air conditioning and we couldnâ€™t open the window because the room next to us could walk in!!! We stayed one night and then I upgraded the room. (We were lucky to get an upgraded room as the receptionist said there may not be one available but to pack our bags and vacate our room in case becomes available) The upgraded room was no better (the only bonus was free WIFI which we used to book another hotel!). The shower room was dark and dirty, when we arrived in the room there was a band aid on the floor of the bathroom which stayed on the floor of the bathroom even after the room was supposedly cleaned the next day! As a regular traveller to Amsterdam I can't see us being back in this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for pesty charges”
Reviews.Author: Attabear
Reviews.Content: Every once in a while you find a hotel that tries (usually succeeds) in hitting you up for $50 or so in extras - this one insisted on collecting $20 in "city tax" even though my voucher clearly said all taxes were paid, and also $35 for two local outgoing and 2 local incoming calls. Not going to ruin a $10,000 vacation, but still it's a reason to pick another hotel if, like me, you think this kind of petty stuff is annoying.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: cpr2exs
Reviews.Content: receptionist was very friendly, cheerful and helpful. allowed me to check in at midday, room was spacious and well presented. bed was very comfortable. location close to all the major attractions - i hardly took transport - always walked - close to the pretty canals.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and good value.”
Reviews.Author: BeerDrinkers
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good location. We walked every where from it. About a 10 minute walk to the Train station. About a 5 minute walk to the Leidseplein area. The room was nice and spacious. The bathroom was also spacious. There was a computer to use but it cost 3 euros for 9 minutes on the internet (pricey!). The staff was very friendly. No breakfast included. I would stay here again and there was nothing I didn't like about the room and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but could be much more.”
Reviews.Author: FrugalFly
Reviews.Content: On street front, noisy but double-paned glass works. Centrally located to walk everywhere, and safe. Very clean room & bathroom. Small beds and bed-fitting blankets, not good for big people. Limited tv. Good AC. No 110V power port, but adapter available sometimes at front desk. Free wi-fi internet in lobby only, and it was a bit slow. Restaurant bar in lobby looked nice, and had good coffee. No free breakfast. Friendly and helpful staff. Nearby market, shops, food. Flower market walk down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a short break”
Reviews.Author: jzx
Reviews.Content: Quite a good location - could walk/tram to most major tourist attractions in the city. Some nice places to eat/drink close by too. Room good value for a major European city. We went for a Deluxe room - worth the upgrade for the late check-out alone (2pm)! Breakfast v.good, with a wide range of options, including many suitable for vegetarians. Friendly & efficient staff on reception. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: btcLancashire
Reviews.Content: The train station has a facility to print a map to the hotel of your choice. We walked from the station to the Albus Grand. (Plenty of trams available for only 1.60 Euro) Once there we were upgraded as all non smoking standard rooms were full. The deluxe room was very comfortable and clean. Some road traffic noise had to be offset against the super location. Restaurants and bars close by. Staff very helpful and friendly. We did not have breakfast in the hotel but many people did. The get together restaurant did not seem to attract people in the evening but so many other interesting places close by this was not a problem. We had breakfast in Rembrandtsplein watching people catching trams and cycling around. Easy walking distance to all attractions and close by the canal boat stop. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Booked short notice, good experience”
Reviews.Author: lobster68w
Reviews.Content: My g/f had a long weekend off and decided she wanted to meet me in Amsterdam. Well, after doing some searching trying to find a place to stay on short notice during peak tourist season, I came across this place. I didn't want to book a place outside of the city center, and the price was right for this place. Getting to the hotel is pretty easy. Its right on a tram line that you can get on at Centraal Station and hop off a block away from hotel. Otherwise it's a 15-20 min walk to the train station. The inside lobby was nice, and the front desk staff helpful. I had booked a room with a double, but instead we got two singles that you had to push together. Not very impressed with that. The room itself was OK, but the window opened to the busy street below. Not having A/C was somewhat of a draw back as you'd have to open the window which REALLY brought the noise in. The shower was another thing that wasn't the greatest design. The tub was in a weird corner and there were no shower curtains so water went everywhere. We stayed for four nights, but I don't think I'd go back again. The price was too high for what we got. I'd had better experiences in budget hotels/hostels than this.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, everything else was very poor”
Reviews.Author: Shdaow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a good central location, but there is nothing about it which is remotely Grand. The reception was well presented but the rooms are very basic and the 'power' shower was appalling and wasn't even good enough to wash properly with. The lift was broken twice during a 3 night stay and the cleaners were very inconsiderate every morning having a chat outside the room early in the morning. The inclusive breakfast was cold and of limited choice but certainly wasn't a full American breakfast, I would recommend eating out if you choose to stay in this hotel. The restaurant staff were generally unhelpful and rude. The TV in the room didn't work and when asking for this to be fixed the staff could not help or offer any solution like an alternative room. The hotel is located in a busy nightlife area and the road is very noisy and busy until the early hours of the morning around 4 am if the window was open the bedroom door rattled constantly. The beds were very soft and not comfortable at all. Generally very disappointing but Amsterdam is a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: Midgiepug
Reviews.Content: Its very central to the Dam Square and the central shopping areas. Very easy to reach from Central Station on the tram. You get off at Muntplein. Hotel is located on a busy road. 3 of us shared one room facing onto the busy road. Not the best for noise and traffic. Overall hotel is very average. Facilities are too dated and for 3 stars we have stayed in better and at better value for money. Breakfast was not included on our package ( we didnt realise) and went for breakfast just 1 of the 2 mornings of our stay. What a mistake!!! Far too expensive at 14 euros each for what it was. You find far better and cheaper outside to eat. The room had stained and burns on carpets and bathroom was very basic. Smoking is permitted in public places and this meant the hotel had a awful smell of cigarettes from the reception area to the hallways of the bedroom floors. Lucky we were only there for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: BMtraveller
Reviews.Content: Good location in basically an old hotel with some cosmetic upgrades. I was lucky to have a room facing the back of the building so I avoided most of the street noise my friends suffered with a room facing the street. Bathrooms were a bit odd - no tub, which is fine, but only a shower curtain to reign in the water so for you splashers out there beware or the entire floor will end up soaked. Also piddly water stream from the shower, it's like taking a shower under a spray can. Good for water conservationists, bad for heavy bathers. Also for the price we paid, breakfast should have been included. But it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: jnick325
Reviews.Content: While it's certainly not the Krasnapolsky at Dam Square, the Albus Grand proved as a solid home base for my girlfriend and I's 5 day stay in the bustling city of Amsterdam. The rooms were very basic, but adequate. They were small, but not overly small where we felt cramped. Make sure you get a room with a window facing the main street for more lighting. The beds were firm, but comfy. The bathroom was also adequate, but got very wet, which is the norm in Amsterdam. The walls were very thin, but I expect this is a common issue in Amsterdam hotels. Don't expect luxury here, but we weren't t planning on spending much time in our room anyway. The location makes the Albus Grand. It's centrally located. It's a quick 2 minute walk to Rembrandt Square, and a short walk to Dam Sqaure and Leidse Square. The only area tough to access by foot was the Red Light District. A tram stops about a block away and takes you everywhere. The only complaint, and this was minor, is the front desk staff. They lacked professionalism and were not courteous for the most part. They seemed uninterested in making our stay more pleasurable. One attendant said, "we don't give anything away for free here." Another, "this is only a 3 star hotel," what do you expect? And the lounge downstairs is well decorated, but worthless. All in all, money well spent. Book through the hotel's web site.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: pipilong
Reviews.Content: We are a couple aged 19 and stayed at the albus grand hotel for 4 nights. The hotel it self was ok, the rooms were rather small and the rooms were boiling. I would not recomend going here in warm weather. The hotels location was brilliant. It was only a short walk away from dam square. We only had breakfast in the hotel once and it was horrible, i would not recomend this at all. The tram stops just outside the hotel and it costs less that 2euro to get to dam square. Would not recomend eating in the pizza resteraunt next store, but dam square had lovely places to eat. Overall this hotel is great for its location, and if like us all you want is just a place to sleep as we were out most of the time exploring the city, it is ideal

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: GeneOlympiaWA
Reviews.Content: Great location - just a block from the floating flower market and from Rembrandt Plaza. Plenty of restaurants nearby as well as a grocery, bakery, etc. Hotel breakfast very generous (eggs, bacon, sausage, granola, cheeses, etc). Planning on returning this Fall and staying here again (this is my 6th trip and the only time I have decided to stay at the same hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: HOLIDAYoholic
Reviews.Content: Do not expect Luxury at this hotel, the rooms are very basic, though the room was clean and myself and my partner were provided with fresh towels each day, and you cannot beat this hotel for price and location, it is central to all the shops and attractions in Amsterdam. The staff at the hotel were very friendly, though it was a disappointment to find the hotel bar closed early each night and on the last day of my stay with my partner it was not open at all. Though because of the hotel's good location, we were lucky to find plenty of other bar's and restaurants within the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location (behind the Flower Markets)”
Reviews.Author: janetmartinezrey
Reviews.Content: Great location when we eventually found it!! Hopped onto a tram from Central Station but unfortunately nobody spoke English so we missed our stop, but found after going into one of the shops nearby. When we arrived Sat 10th March and went to check in, the receptionist explained that she did not have a room for us that night but only on Sunday, and we could stay in a 4 star nearby and then come back the following night. Told her not happy about it. So I contacted Hotel Connect (who we made our booking with - fantastic company) to ask what was happening with our booking, she promptly phoned the hotel, we could hear the conversation as we were sat in the lobby - quite funny really. After the receptionist put the phone down she then informed me that they did have a room afterall, but we could not check in after 2pm. ( We arrived @ 11am!!) We went out for a well earned drink and came back and we were actually given a family room on the 7th floor, nice view ( but a very warm room) given that the weather was fab for the duration of our stay. Breakfast was good but staff had a bit of an attitude to be honest. Would I stay there again, yes

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MMMH
Reviews.Content: I returned from a trip tp Amsterdam yesterday having stayed with 5 friends in this hotel. We had a really nice time there and would recommend the hotel to any one travelling to Amsterdam. The staff at the reception desk are very friendly and helpful. A few points to note however, we had booked three non-smoking rooms yet we all ended up in smoking rooms where there was a very strong smell of smoke. There is no safe in the room which I did not like and to leave valuables at reception costs â‚¬1.50 a day. Now,a potentially big problem:This hotel accepts stag/hen parties. We were lucky as there was a gang of English guys who did not make a sound and did not wake us but not everyone might be so lucky! When they say breakfast is served until 10.30 at weekends that means you must be in and seated with your breakfast in front of you at that time......don't arrive at the last minute as we did or you'll be turned away(we had gone by the clock on the T.V. in the room which was slow). Some of our gang went for breakfast one morning and felt that it was not particularly good value for what they got and did not go any other day. The hotel in well situated anyway with lots of nice cafes and restaurants nearby. (Do NOT go to the Italian next to the hotel....poor food, dreadfully slow and an unpleasant whiff from the loos!). The rooms are very hot with no A.C. so be sure to leave the window open during the day to keep the room cool. If you enjoy walking around a city then you will love the location. Although a few minutes south of Dam Square it was not far at all and was quite near the Heineken Brewery so we could walk there too. It is just around the corner from the Flower markets(lots of nice little cafes here, try the first one on the left "Amaryllis" for breakfast). We really enjoyed our stay and liked the hotel(you also get a complimentary drink from the bar between 5 and 7 p.m. which is a nice gesture).

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: martijn.v.bakker
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, and good service. Rooms are OK. Shower room is very simple. No shower cabin, but shower is just seperated by curtain from rest of the shower room (toilet, sink etc.) Breakfast was less than I expected. They have the standards (bread, scrambled eggs, bacon etc.), but the quality is not so good. Staff is good and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Albus Grand was Grand”
Reviews.Author: krossikatz
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend stayed there last weekend, and as said before it is in a great location (after we went around in circles). Staff are very friendly and the rooms very clean and quite big, we were at the front of the hotel on the 4th floor but heard no noise even with the trams outside. Getting around with the trams is excellent. Get a tram outside central station to the hotel as we got ripped off by taxi at 20 euro's!!! Great hotel, good location and lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “well worth it”
Reviews.Author: curlyred666
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my fiancee and 2 friends for 5 nights and thought this hotel was grand. Me and my partner stayed on the ground floor which was quiet and had a balcony, so you could have a smoke or getr some air. I found the room comfortable and the staff friendly. Its a great location beside lots of shopping and restaurants. theres a cheap coffeeshop just round the corner and a lovely tapas bar. If you walk 2mins you get to the tram stop and then its 5 mins into town. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: zato
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed one night in the Albus. The location was perfect for us. It is a two minute walk to the flower market and the canal tour, and a few additional minutes to Rembrandt Square for eating and people watching. We walked everywhere and loved the atmosphere. The young, dark-haired man at the reception desk was extremely helpful. He pleasantly gave us information to our questions, and he sent help up to our room when needed. The room was basic and clean. We booked one week prior to arrival and paid 109 euros, or $126.00 U.S. , excluding 5% tax. The price had gone down over the previous days I had checked. The one big drawback was that it was a gorgeous day for sightseeing, but that meant our room on the top floor of the hotel was extremely hot because of the lack of air conditioning . We survived and would go back there again. Upon checking out there was a shuttle bus for 12 euros each heading to the airport. We picked it up across the street. The very efficient front desk arranged for this, and we paid the shuttle bus driver. Smooth and simple. We totally enjoyed Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Saint_C
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel in a great location. All the staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The room was comfortable and plenty of space for 2 girls, each with a weeks worth of luggage! The only niggle was that the bathroom, although large and very clean, did not have a window or extractor fan and got very very hot. There are loads of nice restaurants and bars in Rembrandtplein and along Reguliersdwarstraat. Particularly liked the Bangkok (Thai) and Roses Cantina (Mexican). Don't miss the half price cocktail hour at the Aussie bar either! The location was great, with all the major sites within walking distance. Try to walk along the canals (gracht) rather than the main streets which can get very noisy and busy. Besides which, it's a much nicer view on the canals. The hotel has an arrangement with a shuttle bus service (Connexions) which will bring you straight from the airport to the hotel for 12 euro each way. You can also book this to go back to the airport on departure (just ask at reception). I found this service really convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SplottGirl
Reviews.Content: I returned this evening from a 3 night stay in the Albus Grand. On arrival we were upgraded to a superior room at no extra cost. I asked the receptionist why she had upgraded us .. she said she wanted us to have a happy day. That was a great start to a wonderful weekend. We were given room 202. It was beautifully clean, had plenty of toiletries and tea/coffee etc. Beds were extrememely comfortable with crisp white bedding. The only draw back was that it was very noisy coming from the street (no double glazing). However this could be rectified with ear plugs .. no big deal there. Breakfast was good although my friend thought the scrambled eggs far too creamy. After check out we were able to leave our luggage in a locked room at no extra cost. Amsterdam is a lovely city with very laid back people. I look forward to re-visiting and would definitely be staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: siddalla
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Albus Grand for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. We had a basic room which was very nice , although extremely hot and very noisy. Great location, close to everything. The staff were very friendly & helpful. I would recommend this hotel for location but do not expect to get alot of sleep. If using a taxi to get around ask the hotel to call one for you, its double the price if you get one when out.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: pietrish
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from amsterdam, the albus hotel is a brill place to stay, central to everything and a 5mins walk to dam square.the hotel was very clean and spacious, rooms were cleaned every day and clean towels put out. very friendly staff. lovely hotel bar where you can purchase breakfast at an extra cost. highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: EC2006
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Albus from the 30thApril - 3rd May this year and I must say we had a very enjoyable stay. The hotel is very clean and bright. The check in/out was quick and reception staff were very friendly. Our room was of average size, very clean and bright. Our bathroom had no extractor which was a bit of a pain but apart from that it was fine. We were delighted with the location of this hotel, you could not get a more central location. I couldn't believe how quiet the hotel was seen as it was so central, no noise from the trams or anything. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning on visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelguru4u
Reviews.Content: Check-in was easy. The room was very clean and spacious-room 701 Triple. The staff was friendly and helpful. Best way to the hotel from Center Station is to take Tram #4 , but you can walk. It's about a 15/20 min walk. The location was excellent!They offer an extended check out until 2:00.The only complaint was the shower water pressure-very weak.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DLPatterson
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights from 26th - 29th March. We booked the deluxe room, non smoking and with a shower. The room was spacious and we were at the front of the hotel. We did not find it too noisey. Beds were comfortable. We felt 14 euro was a bit much for breakfast and found a lovely cafe facing the flower market and had a good breakfast for 6.50 euro. The hotel is well situated within the city and close to all the major attractions. We would definitely come back to this hotel on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Betina
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the hotel. We had no breakfast as we thought that paying 14 euro per breakfast was a bit expensive adding 28 euro to our hotel bill. The staff was very polite and helpful. The hotel's location is great. Its near the Rembrandtsplein. Many restaurants are nearby, the flower market, shopping area and its easy to get there by tram or walk (half an hour to the train station without luggage). The rooms are very basically furnished, no bathtub in the "standard rooms", but if you are lucky to get a room at the back, its also very quiet unlike the front rooms. I do think that you can find better hotels for the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DebOnTheWeb
Reviews.Content: I was also wary about staying here after reading some of the reviews, but my husband and I are glad we did. Officially, the hotel is a 3 star, and it was what I expect for a 3 star hotel in Europe (which is not exactly equivalent with a 3 star hotel in the U.S.) The location was very convenient - right by the Munt clocktower (see the photo taken out of our window) and a block from Rembrantplein. We were directly across from the Jolly Hotel which wanted $200 more per night. Although our room faced the street, we barely noticed when a tram went by. The breakfast was a convenient way to start our day. I booked directly through the Utell site (the hotel's parent company) and took a run of house room. When we got there, I asked it it was possibly to upgrade. The upgrade only cost us $20 per night and that included free internet access which was normally $15 per day, so I was pleased. I read a review here where someone complained about the shower. Yes, the shower is in a corner of the bathroom and part of the same floor, but we found that as long as we closed the curtain, the water stayed in the shower area. If you're looking for a nice, central location at a reasonable price, try this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Myself and my fiancee stayed here with a group of friends. Some of them had some concerns after reading one or two negative reviews given I had booked the hotel I hoped they were not true. We were all very pleasantly surprised. We found the rooms to be clean, modern and comfortable. The staff we found to be pleasant and helpful. The location is pretty much perfect. There is a bit of an issue with water on the bathroom floor but with a little care that can be avoided. Overall, I give it a big thumbs up and would happily recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights. room lovely, hotel very clean staff helpful would recommend it. Was weary after reading some reviews before I left but thankfully I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “not great at all”
Reviews.Author: Elise2929
Reviews.Content: I always use trip advisor to check hotels before booking and the reviews for this hotel were ok. When we were last in Amsterdam we went in to the reception area and it looked ok and new. I booked this hotel for my parents as it was a present. I was so disappointed when they came back and had so many little but annoying problems. They booked an upgraded room and they said it was ok, the rooms were very noisy from the road outside, the window catch was broken, the room amenities were not toped up. There was nowhere in the hotel to get a drink or anything after the breakfast room shut in the morning. Over all it is not somewhere they would go back to. The room wasn't cheap, the location of the hotel is great but doesn't out way the other down falls, including the unhelpful reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, great location only 10 mins from dam square and 15 from cenral station. Room was good size very clean with modern furnishing. We stayed in room 102 on the ground floor. Hotel is done out lovely with a modern touch, if you want a hotel that is not in "dodgy" areas of amsterdam this will be for you. The only fault would be our room was not ready till 1.30 hours after check in, but apart from this slight error we will definitely be returning, as the hotel was priced at 205 euros for 3 nights in a standard room via lastminute. Highly Recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “If I could change hotel.......”
Reviews.Content: WE stay for four night, Great location, However the front desk staff was not very friendly or knowledgable about their wonderful city. THe room we stay in was large and dark, not enough to light to light up the space, so no reading could be none (and we are not over 40) . They had dirty sheets on the bed upon arrival & could not change until the next day.I could go on but I won"t. A great location but not a good hotel match for us . I rate this hotel a 2.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a last resort as every other one was sold out. Did not tell my wife it was a 2 Star hotel. Pros: location Central - easy walking distance of the DAM, Redlight District and Amsterdam Central Station Rooms Clean, Bathroom a real surprise, I have stayed in 4 & 5 Star hotels in the UK and Carribbean and this one exceeded them all. Staff Friendly polite - found the Dutch to be extremely helpful, had no use for a phrase book. Food Restaurant was tendy, only had a coffee and desert, but very stylish and always crowded. Cons: Room facing the street are noisy from passing pedestrain traffic. Some people felt the need to shout all the time. Reccommendation It's very clean and exceeded my expectations. Staff were good, no room safes, but one could be rented near reception for 2 Euro a day. Get a room at the back of the hotel to escape the noise on the street. Will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “What a little trendy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eugene uk
Reviews.Content: We found the Albus Grand a highly stylish, modern 3 star hotel, conveniently located in the very heart of Amsterdam, literally steps from Muntplein and virtually around the corner from Rembrandtplein. Mind you, such privileged location also meant our exterior room could get slightly noisy at times despite the double glazed windows! The staff were friendly and helpful, with a good command of English. Our room was spacious and very tastefully decorated, with brand-new furniture, satellite TV and a fancy press iron, but no mini bar, safe or air con though! Luckily, the weather was quite mild during our stay, otherwise we might have found it rather difficult to sleep with the windows open and all the noise outside. The bathroom was also very spacious and well appointed, with free toiletries and a hair dryer. Breakfast was simply delicious, served in a small, trendy restaurant on the ground floor, consisting of all sorts of bread and rolls, hot and cold meats, fruit, yoghurt, tea and coffee. All very nicely prepared and presented. Definitely something to look forward first thing in the morning! All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at the Albus Grand and would not hesitate to stay at this property again, although next time we would definitely try to get an interior room.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As we travel all over the world and have seen so many hotels, we really can say this is a hotel to recommend, wonderfull, helpfull staff. very nice, clean rooms and a supurb location !! All sightseeing things are on walking distance and the nightlife starts around the corner. If you want to go for a nice weekend then this is the right address, but also when you are in Amsterdam for business, no doubt you will enjoy this hotel with free internet connection in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: robcat35
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 3 days at the Grand Albus with 9 members of my family with an age range of 68 to 21. We were all impressed by the hotels excellent rooms and very friendly and helpful staff. The location of the hotel is absolutely ideal with only a short walk to Dam square and most other attractions. The only compaint would be the tiny breakfast room but as this was been refurbished while we were there this problem should soon be solved. Overall a very pleasant hotel and which we will be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: ParisExpat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in November 04. This hotel is very basic and the restaurant only serves breakfast (extra 15 euros! - better to eat outside). The bathroom was below average, a dribbly shower head and one of those non-cubicle showers that soaks the whole bathroom, perhaps explaining the grotty state of the bathroom floor. However, it's not all bad. The location is perfect for both sighseeing and entertainment, just off Rembrandstplein, and walkable to the (better) nightlife off Leidseplein. The bedroom was fine, if basic - well heated, comfortable bed, generally clean. One minor incident - I got back to my room one evening to find a mysterious pair of ladies panties on my bedroom floor (nothing to do with me!). Not sure what this says about security or what the cleaning lady gets up to.. I paid 109 Euros per night, which is a very fair price for this hotel. I would stay here again if I'm travelling alone (I'm a business travellor) but would look for somewhere with more charm if travelling in a couple.

Reviews.Title: “It is good! We would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Inhabitant
Reviews.Content: We spend the weekend of 6 and 7 november in Amsterdam, Albus Grand Hotel. The hotel is at a central location in Amsterdam. Only 10 min. walk from station and a few min. away from several musea etc. The staff is friendly and helpfull. The room is clean and good. Breakfast is good. Eggs, bacon, cereal etc... also the staff in the morning is friendly and very quick. We would def. go back to Albus Grand Hotel in Amsterdam!

HotelInfo.Name: The Albus
HotelInfo.Address: Vijzelstraat 49, Amsterdam 1017 HE, The Netherlands
